greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n with maximal up-step <= k; n>=1, 0<=k<n.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of compositions [p(1), p(2), ..., p(k)] of n such that max(p(j) - p(j-1)) <= k.
Rows are partial sums of rows of A225084.
The first column is A000041 (partition numbers), the second column is A003116, and the third column is A224959.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
example: The fifth row corresponds to the following statistics:
There are 7 compositions with no up-step (M<=0), 13 with M<=1, 15 with M<=2, 16 with M<=3, and 16 with M<=4.
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 27 2013
